abstract: Stock prices fell sharply on Tuesday on renewed worries about the housing market and weakness in energy shares after the Obama administration said it would appeal a ruling by a federal judge blocking a moratorium on deep-water drilling.
snippet: Stock prices fell sharply on Tuesday on renewed worries about the housing market and weakness in energy shares after the Obama administration said it would appeal a ruling by a federal judge blocking a moratorium on deep-water drilling.
lead_paragraph: Stock prices fell sharply on Tuesday on renewed worries about the housing market and weakness in energy shares after the Obama administration said it would appeal a ruling by a federal judge blocking a moratorium on deep-water drilling.

headline.main: Shares Slide on Weakness in Energy
